isis.stitle: FAN DRIVE CLUTCH: HORTON ON/OFF - MAINTENANCE - SYSTEM CHECKS

svcprocinfo.para: To ensure proper operation of your fan clutch, perform the following checks prior to placing vehicle back in service.

step1.para: Check for bent, cracked or missing fan blades and loose fan blade rivets.
Tighten fan blade nuts to 19 to 27 ft-lbs. (26 to 37 N•m) or capscrews to 140 to 190 in-lbs. (16 to 21 N•m).
Check for adequate clearance between fan and fan shroud.

svcsubproc.title: Fan Belts

note.para: Belt adjustment and alignment are necessary to ensure satisfactory component life. Overtightening belts will shorten clutch bearing life. Loose belts will cause excessive belt wear.

svcsubproc.para: For more detailed information concerning belt service and tension, refer to GROUP 12 - ENGINE, Cooling section in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: Check belt condition; replace if worn or frayed.
Spin sheave and clutch plate to ensure bearings provide smooth, even rotation in both directions.
Check for proper engagement and disengagement by applying 90 to 120 psi clean air pressure to clutch.

svcsubproc.title: Check Shutter Operation and Cooling System
svcsubproc.para: For more detailed information on shutter and cooling, refer to GROUP 12 - ENGINE, Cooling section in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: Shutters must open completely before fan engages.

caution.para: If shutters are used, they must be open 10°F below thermal switch sensing temperature. This is to ensure that shutters are always open before fan clutch engages. If not, overheating could result, causing engine damage.

step1.para: Ensure fan engages at correct temperature.

svcsubproc.title: Filter
svcsubproc.para: This is a lifetime unit that should be drained weekly and may be disassembled and cleaned.
